decks.notes: This deck focuses on controlling the board and generating value through powerful creatures and spells. By ramping up mana with cards like Cultivate and Genesis Ultimatum, the deck aims to cast big threats like Terror of the Peaks and Beanstalk Giant to overwhelm the opponent. With a mix of removal spells like Spikefield Hazard and versatile creatures like Brazen Borrower, the deck can handle a variety of threats while maintaining pressure on the opponent. The goal is to establish a dominant board presence and outvalue the opponent through strong tempo plays and efficient card advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to ramp up quickly with mana generation cards like Gilded Goose and Ilysian Caryatid and then play powerful creatures like Feasting Troll King and Kogla, the Titan Ape to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes cards like The Great Henge and Castle Garenbrig to further ramp up and draw cards. The overall strategy is to go wide with creatures and overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on using mill effects, counterspells, and removal to control the board while efficiently drawing cards and reducing the opponent's library size. By utilizing a mix of disruptive creatures like Thieves' Guild Enforcer and Ruin Crab alongside powerful spells like Into the Story and Drown in the Loch, this deck aims to outlast opponents by depleting their resources and eventually winning through attrition or decking them out. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value and recursion for low-cost permanents.

This deck focuses on quickly building up a board of aggressive creatures, using powerful combat tricks and removal spells to push through damage. By utilizing cards like Brushfire Elemental and Lovestruck Beast alongside powerful equipments like Embercleave, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient aggression. The Great Henge provides additional card draw and ramp, giving the deck resilience against control strategies. The inclusion of cards like Bonecrusher Giant and Questing Beast provide additional reach and flexibility in dealing with various threats.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and mill effects. By utilizing cards like Drown in the Loch, Lullmage's Domination, and Into the Story, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also milling their library with cards like Ruin Crab and Merfolk Windrobber. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for recursion of key creatures and spells, providing additional staying power in longer games. Overall, the deck focuses on outlasting opponents and grinding out a victory through attrition.

The deck focuses on controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's strategy through a combination of removal spells, enchantments, and counter spells. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by recurring cards with Yorion, Sky Nomad and Dance of the Manse, while also leveraging powerful cards like Elspeth Conquers Death and Skyclave Apparition to deal with threats. The deck also utilizes card draw and mana fixing to ensure consistency in its game plan, ultimately grinding out the opponent to secure victory.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on quickly playing powerful creatures and using them to deal damage to the opponent as efficiently as possible. With a mix of low-cost creatures like Brushfire Elemental and Lovestruck Beast, along with removal spells like Fire Prophecy and Bonecrusher Giant, the deck aims to pressure the opponent early and keep the aggression going. The inclusion of cards like The Great Henge and Embercleave provide additional power boosts to the creatures, making it difficult for the opponent to keep up with the onslaught of threats.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures and powerful combat tricks. By ramping up mana with cards like The Great Henge and using creatures like Lovestruck Beast and Questing Beast, it can quickly deal significant damage to the opponent. Additionally, the deck includes removal spells like Fire Prophecy and Bonecrusher Giant to deal with opposing threats. The key strategy is to maintain a relentless offensive pressure to quickly defeat the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on using a combination of evasive creatures and disruptive spells to apply pressure on the opponent quickly and efficiently. By filling the graveyard with various cards, the deck can utilize cards like Drown in the Loch and Soaring Thought-Thief to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, cards like Rankle, Master of Pranks and Zareth San, the Trickster provide additional ways to disrupt the opponent's hand and board state while also presenting a quick clock for them to contend with. Overall, the deck aims to win the game through aggressive creatures and disrupting the opponent's strategy.

This deck focuses on using cards that control the board, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and generate card advantage. By utilizing cards like Doom Foretold, Elspeth's Nightmare, and Skyclave Apparition, the deck aims to maintain board presence and limit the opponent's options. The inclusion of cards like Yorion, Sky Nomad and Dance of the Manse allows for extra value by flickering permanents or bringing them back from the graveyard. The deck also includes a mix of removal spells and counterspells to deal with threats and protect its own game plan.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on fast-paced, aggressive gameplay with a combination of powerful creatures like Questing Beast and Lovestruck Beast, backed up by powerful support cards like Embercleave and The Great Henge. With a low mana curve and plenty of ways to deal damage quickly, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can set up their own strategy. The inclusion of cards like Shatterskull Smashing and Bonecrusher Giant provide flexibility and additional removal options to keep the pressure on the opponent.

The main concept of this Gruul Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures, backed up by powerful equipment and enchantments. By combining creatures like Brushfire Elemental and Questing Beast with cards like Embercleave and The Great Henge, the deck aims to deal a lot of damage quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of cards like Vivien, Monsters' Advocate and Embereth Shieldbreaker also provides additional versatility and disruption to deal with potential threats from the opponent. Overall, the key strategy is to establish board presence early and maintain pressure throughout the game.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent with aggressive creatures from the Mono Green color pool. Utilizing cards like Feasting Troll King and Wicked Wolf alongside mana producers like Gilded Goose and Tangled Florahedron, you can quickly build a strong board presence. The inclusion of cards like Trail of Crumbs and The Great Henge not only provide card advantage but also pump up your creatures. The deck aims to ramp up quickly and keep the pressure on your opponent, forcing them to react to your threats.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using powerful Mono Green creatures. The deck includes a mix of powerful creatures like Feasting Troll King and Kogla, the Titan Ape, along with support cards like The Great Henge and Trail of Crumbs to generate card advantage and mana ramp. The overall goal is to quickly build a strong board presence and apply pressure to the opponent, while also utilizing cards like Witch's Oven and Wolfwillow Haven for additional synergy and utility.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly populate the board with strong and resilient creatures, using mana acceleration to ramp up into powerful threats. By utilizing efficient creatures and a strong curve, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a relentless onslaught of aggression, backed up by a solid mana base and card advantage engines. The combination of large threats, efficient removal, and access to additional resources from cards like The Great Henge and Trail of Crumbs allows the deck to maintain pressure and close out games quickly.

The main concept of the deck is to control the game through powerful creatures and disruptive spells while utilizing the companion Obosh, the Preypiercer to enhance the deck's damage output. The deck focuses on ramping into big threats like Terror of the Peaks and Beanstalk Giant, while also generating card advantage with Edgewall Innkeeper. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of board presence and burn spells like Spikefield Hazard, all supported by the mana fixing provided by cards like Fabled Passage and Ketria Triome.
